intro: Mesembryanthemum aurantiacum, commonly known as the orange iceplant, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its succulent leaves and showy flowers. The plant produces vibrant orange to red flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its fleshy, water-storing leaves help it survive in arid environments. The species is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and drought tolerance.
